title: How Things Can Go Wrong When You Ignore .gitignore
description: This two-minute read discusses ignoring the .gitignore with Git/GitHub and offers a quick guide on how to recover from this mistake.

title: How I Trained a CNN Model on a Large Dataset with Limited Resources: Incremental Learning in Action
description: My team and I were trying to train a ML model on a binary dataset. The training job kept crashing due to memory over-utilization. This article outlines a solution using incremental learning to train a CNN model on a large dataset with limited resources, providing step-by-step instructions and code snippets for implementation.

title: 7 Git and GitHub Mistakes That Will Kill Your Reputation (And How to Avoid Them)
description: This article discusses seven common Git and GitHub mistakes that can negatively impact a developer's reputation, along with strategies to avoid them. It emphasizes best practices such as using .gitignore, choosing descriptive branch names, and utilizing pull requests for code review.
